intro: Senecio tovarii, commonly known as the Mexican groundsel, is a flowering plant native to Mexico. It belongs to the Asteraceae family, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant typically grows in rocky or sandy soils and is often found in arid or semi-arid environments. It produces small yellow flowers that bloom in the summer months, and its leaves are usually gray-green with a fuzzy texture. Senecio tovarii is sometimes cultivated as an ornamental plant due to its unique appearance and drought tolerance.
